intro: Cycnoseris, commonly known as the white lotus, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Nymphaeaceae. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that float on the surface of still or slow-moving water. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that are typically submerged or floating. Cycnoseris species are native to tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Asia and Africa. They play an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen to water organisms.
